page.title: 15Fardel Farm,Cornwood
page.content: Fardel farm,owned by Mr.Derek Dennis, consists of 375 acres and supports a Pedigree dairy herd of Freisians and Holsteins,built up over 30 yrs.Mr Dennis,and his son Jeremy,milk 140 cows,producing on average 2000 litres per day,and rear approx.200 followers & calves.Common Market regulations have meant a cut-back in quota this year.The farm has 1 bull,although most breeding is artificial,using eggs from best milkers, implanted into surrogate cows of lesser quality, which are then inseminated(artifically).200 hoggets are run on the land in winter,when the cattle are kept under cover.Grass is cut(3 times over per year) for silage, while hay harvesting has been abandon- ed as too time-consuming and uneconom- ic.A small amount of Spring barley is grown.Despite large machinery,only one hedge has so far been removed.
